Class Customer

  • java.lang.Object
    • User
      • Customer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class Customer
extends User
    A class that holds the general informations and customerNumber, phoneNumber, address, pastOrders, newOrders info and methods of a Customer entity.

      • totalCustomerCount

        public static int totalCustomerCount

    • Constructor Detail

      • Customer

        public Customer()
        Constructor that sets everything as an empty string and the status as old. It should be avoided to use this constructor.

      • Customer

        public Customer(java.lang.String nameInfo,
        java.lang.String surnameInfo,
        java.lang.String mailInfo,
        java.lang.String passInfo)
        Parameters:
        nameInfo - is a String that will be the name of the user
        surnameInfo - is a String that will be the surname of the user
        mailInfo - is a String that will be the email of the user
        passInfo - is a String that will be the password of the user. Constructor that sets the user information as the given information. Also sets the status as new.

      • Customer

        public Customer(java.lang.String nameInfo,
        java.lang.String surnameInfo,
        java.lang.String mailInfo,
        java.lang.String passInfo,
        java.lang.String statusInfo)
        Parameters:
        nameInfo - is a String that will be the name of the user
        surnameInfo - is a String that will be the surname of the user
        mailInfo - is a String that will be the email of the user
        passInfo - is a String that will be the password of the user
        statusInfo - is a String that will be the status of the user. It should be either new or old. Constructor that sets the user information as the given information. Increments the totalCustomerCount everytime a new costumer is created. This will be used in the determination of customer numbers.

    • Method Detail

      • getCustomerNo

        public int getCustomerNo()
        Returns:
        the customer number of the customer.

      • getTotalCustomerCount

        public static int getTotalCustomerCount()
        Returns:
        the totalCustomerCount.

      • getNewOrder

        public Product getNewOrder(int orderIndex)
                    throws InvalidIndex
        Parameters:
        orderIndex - will be the index that will be used to return one of the new orders. It should be bigger than 0 and smaller than newOrders.length.
        Returns:
        the new order in the index orderIndex of the new orders.
        Throws:
        InvalidIndex - if the orderIndex does not satisfy the requirements.

      • getNewOrderCount

        public int getNewOrderCount()
        Returns:
        0 if the newOrders is null.

      • getPhoneNumber

        public java.lang.String getPhoneNumber()
        Returns:
        NONE if there is not a registered phone number.

      • getAddress

        public java.lang.String getAddress()
        Returns:
        NONE if there is not a registered address.

      • setEmail

        protected void setEmail(java.lang.String newMail)
        This method is used when the status is new. Checks if the email info was registered from before. Sets the email if the email info was not registered from before.
        Specified by:
        setEmail in class User
        Parameters:
        newMail - is a String that will be set as the email information.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Writes the customer name, surname and customer number.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • checkEmail

        protected void checkEmail(java.lang.String mailInfo)
                   throws InvalidStatus
        Checks if the given email information was registered from before.
        Specified by:
        checkEmail in class User
        Parameters:
        mailInfo - is a String that holds and email information that will be searched if it was registered from before.
        Throws:
        InvalidStatus - if the given email information was already registered when the status was new, or the email was not registered when the status was old.

      • removeCustomer

        public void removeCustomer()
        Deletes the employee from the BranchEmployeesInfo.txt file.

      • addNewOrder

        public void addNewOrder(Product addedProduct,
               int storeNo)
        Adds the given product as a new order.
        Parameters:
        addedProduct - is the product that will be added as a new order.
        storeNo - is the store number that the product is ordered from.

      • removeNewOrder

        public void removeNewOrder(Product removedProduct)

        removedProduct - is the product that will be removed from the new orders of the customer.

      • addInfo

        public void addInfo(java.lang.String addressInfo,
           java.lang.String phoneInfo)
        Registers the address and the phoneNumber of the customer.
        Parameters:
        addressInfo - is a String that will be registered as address.
        phoneInfo - is a String that will be registered as phoneNumber.

      • saveInfo

        public void saveInfo(java.lang.String addressInfo,
            java.lang.String phoneInfo)
        Saves and registers the address and the phoneNumber of the customer to CustomersInfo.txt.
        Parameters:
        addressInfo - is a String that will be registered as address.
        phoneInfo - is a String that will be registered as phoneNumber.

      • printPastOrders

        public void printPastOrders()
        Prints out all the past orders. If there is none, prints No Past Orders.

      • printNewOrders

        public void printNewOrders()
        Prints out all the new orders. If there is none, prints No New Orders.

        public int isPastOrder(Product searchedProduct)
        Parameters:
        searchedProduct - is the product that will be searched among the past orders
        Returns:
        the index of the product if it exists inside the pastOrders array.

        Parameters:
